strategic_directives_v2.title: Complete 40-Stage Venture Lifecycle Management System
strategic_directives_v2.description:
Comprehensive venture workflow implementation covering all 40 stages from ideation through exit. 
    This includes multi-venture portfolio coordination, strategic growth management, exit sequencing optimization, 
    and automated PRD generation capabilities. The system provides end-to-end venture lifecycle management with 
    sophisticated portfolio-level optimization and governance features.
strategic_directives_v2.strategic_intent: Transform venture portfolio management through comprehensive lifecycle automation
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: Enable systematic venture creation, growth, and exit optimization across the entire portfolio
strategic_directives_v2.scope: All 40 stages of venture lifecycle from ideation through exit, including portfolio coordination
strategic_objectives: Implement complete 40-stage venture workflow from ideation to exit
Enable multi-venture portfolio coordination and resource optimization
Provide strategic growth and governance management for active ventures
Optimize portfolio exit sequencing for maximum value realization
Automate PRD generation for new venture initiatives
success_criteria: All 40 workflow stages fully implemented and documented
Portfolio coordination system operational across ventures
Exit sequencing optimization achieving target IRR improvements
PRD generation engine producing implementation-ready specifications

strategic_directives_v2.title: The main intent is to enhance the EHG application by adding a toggle button for switching between light mode and dark mode on the chairman page, ensuring that the entire application and all its components function effectively in both modes.
strategic_directives_v2.description: On the EHG application, there is a chairman page. In the top right-hand corner, there is a header that has the chairman icon and avatar. I'd like to add a button to the left of it that's like a toggle between light mode and dark mode. I'd like that to work so that the entire application and all pages in all components work well within light mode and dark mode.
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: On the EHG application, there is a chairman page. In the top right-hand corner, there is a header that has the chairman icon and avatar. I'd like to add a button to the left of it that's like a toggle between light mode and dark mode. I'd like that to work so that the entire application and all pages in all components work well within light mode and dark mode.

strategic_directives_v2.title: Strategic Directive Initiation Protocol (SDIP) - MVP+ Implementation
strategic_directives_v2.description: Implement a comprehensive validation workflow for Strategic Directive creation in the EHG_Engineer dashboard. This feature will transform raw Chairman feedback into properly validated and structured Strategic Directives through a 6-step validation process.
strategic_directives_v2.strategic_intent: Transform unstructured Chairman feedback into validated, actionable Strategic Directives through systematic validation workflow
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: Chairman requires efficient method to create Strategic Directives from raw feedback. Current ad-hoc process lacks validation and consistency.
strategic_directives_v2.scope: EHG_Engineer Dashboard Enhancement - Directive Lab Feature
key_changes: Add new Directive Lab tab to dashboard
Integrate with existing SD creation flow
strategic_objectives: Enable Chairman to create Strategic Directives from raw feedback
Ensure consistent validation and quality control
Reduce directive creation time from hours to minutes
Maintain audit trail and compliance with Mission v3 standards
Improve clarity and actionability of Strategic Directives
success_criteria: Chairman can complete full workflow in <10 minutes
All validation gates enforced without bypassing
Client summaries understood by executives without technical background

metadata.completion_notes: SDIP implementation completed with full MVP+ functionality

strategic_directives_v2.title: OpenAI Realtime Voice Consolidation
strategic_directives_v2.description: OpenAI Realtime Voice consolidation - Updated at 8:24:22 AM
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: Current fragmented voice interfaces create user confusion, cost $1,500/month for 11Labs, and lack intelligent reasoning. OpenAI Realtime with gpt-realtime model provides 48% better instruction following.
strategic_directives_v2.scope: Replace 11Labs Realtime, EVA Voice Conversation, and EVA Text+Speech with single OpenAI Realtime implementation using WebRTC and ephemeral tokens.

strategic_directives_v2.title: Dashboard UI/UX Improvements
strategic_directives_v2.description: This Strategic Directive addresses critical UI/UX improvements needed for the LEO Protocol Dashboard to enhance user experience, accessibility, and operational efficiency. The dashboard serves as the primary interface for managing LEO Protocol workflows, and improvements are essential for productivity.
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: To be filled in from strategic directive document

Out of Scope: Backend API changes, Database schema modifications, Authentication system changes, Third-party integrations.

Increase Operational Efficiency: Reduce click paths and streamline common workflows
Improve Data Visualization: Better progress tracking and status indicators
Ensure Accessibility: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance for all dashboard components
Optimize Performance: Reduce load times and improve real-time updates

All interactive elements have proper accessibility labels

Assess security vulnerabilities

strategic_directives_v2.title: EHG_Engineer Platform Foundation
strategic_directives_v2.description: Establish a minimal, clean LEO Protocol v3.1.5 implementation for strategic directive management. This platform provides the essential components needed to build other applications with proven strategic planning workflows.
strategic_directives_v2.strategic_intent: Create a foundation platform that can be used as a template for building strategic planning applications
strategic_directives_v2.rationale: The full EHG platform has grown complex with interdependencies. A clean, minimal implementation of just the LEO Protocol core components would provide a better foundation for new application development.
strategic_directives_v2.scope: Core LEO Protocol implementation including database schema, strategic directive management, epic execution sequences, HAP blocks, and agent communication templates.
strategic_objectives: Extract core LEO Protocol components from EHG platform
Create minimal database schema with only essential tables
Implement strategic directive lifecycle management
Provide templates for all LEO Protocol artifacts
Enable rapid application development with strategic planning
success_criteria: Complete template system for all artifacts
implementation_guidelines: Phase 1: Foundation setup with Node.js and Supabase
Phase 2: Database schema and core scripts
Phase 4: First strategic directive and testing
success_metrics: All database tables created and accessible

metadata.closure_reason: Foundation platform successfully established and operational

extras.Description_1: Build a dashboard for live agent monitoring inspired by CrewAI, showing state, queue depth, cost, logs, and providing quick actions like pause and restart.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Proven Use Case with AI Twist

extras.Description_1: Encourage cloning successful products (like Grammarly, Loom, Calendly) and layering AI. Must be captured as a module for ideation.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Create Guided Workflow for Brand Identity and Voice Definition

extras.Description_1: Problem: AI-generated content lacks a consistent brand voice. Approach: Create a guided workflow to define a venture's brand identity as a core input for the GTM agent. Value: Ensures all automated marketing is on-brand.
Design EVA voice interface to support hands-free or minimal interaction during driving. Unlocks productivity for reviewing tasks and Gmail via voice.

Translate Outlook tasks "Learning notebook LM ideas" and "Learning plan (weekly)" into structured features for the EVA assistant. During weekly syncs, EVA should be able to walk through pre-defined learning goals, note insights, and track progress in an interactive notebook.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Integrate Google Tasks with EVA Assistant

extras.Description_1: Enable EVA to receive and track assigned actions via Google Tasks. This would allow users to delegate tasks through familiar tools while maintaining EVAs awareness of responsibilities, deadlines, and progress. Integration could include task creation, updates, and completion syncing. Implement a system where users can verbally instruct Google Gemini to create a Google Task, which EVA will automatically detect, monitor, and act upon. EVA should differentiate between tasks assigned to the user versus tasks meant for EVA. This creates a seamless interface between voice-driven task creation and agent-based task execution, enhancing the assistants utility across devices.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Enable Natural Language Custom Reporting in EVA

extras.Description_1: Allow users to ask EVA for custom reports and summaries in natural language, with EVA generating text, charts, and tables on the fly.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Create 'Delegate to Human' Command and Tracking

extras.Description_1: Formalize human-in-the-loop workflows by allowing EVA to explicitly delegate tasks to humans with deadlines, context, and acceptance criteria.

Problem: EVA lacks a persistent, user-editable long-term memory. Approach: Provide a structured "Memory Vault" for users to edit facts, preferences, and glossaries, with support for per-venture scoping and explainability. Value: Enhances EVA's contextual awareness, personalization, and trustworthiness.

Problem: Users cannot switch between voice and text input mid-session without losing context. Approach: Enable seamless in-session toggling between input modes, ensuring continuity of the live transcript and context. Value: Provides a more flexible and natural user interaction model.
Design a moat feature where the more the system understands the user, the more difficult it becomes to leave. This reinforces long-term retention through increasing personalization and lock-in.

Research the capabilities of platforms like Chatbase, which offer AI-powered automated customer support. The goal is to assess their functionality, integration ease, and potential fit within EHG ventures to improve customer service operations.

Problem: Integrating new third-party services is currently an ad-hoc process. Approach: Design a framework and marketplace for integrating external services (e.g., Stripe, Twilio) into the platform. Value: Creates an extensible, powerful ecosystem.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: AI CEO Agent per Company or Portfolio

extras.Description_1: Each company or portfolio in the EHG portfolio should have its own AI Agent that acts as its CEO. This agent should be fully briefed on all aspects of the company or portfolio and able to answer questions, guide decisions, and represent the venture's goals and operations. Serves as the AI interface for leadership and oversight.

Problem: Manually creating go-to-market plans is complex and slow. Approach: Develop a master GTM agent to orchestrate sub-agents for market analysis, channel selection, and campaign execution. Value: Automates the GTM strategist role, enabling a scalable "foundry" model.

Problem: GTM efforts can fail without a clear understanding of the target customer. Approach: Create an agent to synthesize market research and user data into detailed customer personas for use by all other GTM agents. Value: Provides a foundational understanding of the target customer.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: EHG Settings Panel with Stage-Based Subpages

extras.Description_1: EHG needs a robust and scalable settings panel within the platform. The panel should include a general settings tab for high-level configurations and subpages aligned with each venture stage (e.g., Ideation, Evaluation, Build, Launch, etc.). This would allow for modular configuration management, better UX, and ensure that settings are contextual to each part of the venture lifecycle.

To effectively evaluate ROI and the performance of marketing strategies, we need the ability to run forecasting models that factor in marketing costs, server/hosting costs, customer acquisition, and related metrics. This requires deep research into existing tools that can provide marketing effectiveness tracking and financial forecasting. The goal is to create a comprehensive dashboard that integrates all cost and revenue data.

Create an interactive interview tool to help define the users venture interests. Includes fields like industry, market, solution type, ESG, automation potential, profitability, and news relevance. It should allow users to save selections as presets for future filtering. Leverage latest tech trends and tools to ensure ideas are innovative and achievable.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Visualize Venture Opportunities Using Heat Map, Radar Chart, and Timeline

extras.Description_1: Design and implement an interactive dashboard with three key visualizations: (1) a multi-dimensional heat map to assess opportunity scores across factors like moat, market timing, and profitability; (2) a radar chart to compare 35 top opportunities across dimensions; and (3) a stage-based timeline to visualize progression through venture pipeline stages. Each component will support interactivity, drill-down, filtering, and live updates. The system should integrate with EVA scoring models and include a responsive layout for desktop/tablet/mobile. Requires deep research into visualization tools (e.g., D3.js, ECharts, React Flow) and thoughtful data mapping strategy.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Automate Go-To-Market and Customer Inquiry Handling

extras.Description_1: Automating the go-to-market (GTM) process is critical for scaling ventures efficiently, even if long-term traction often shifts to word-of-mouth. The platform should support automated GTM execution while enabling responsive and scalable customer inquiry management. This could involve integrating or building something like Lindyan AI-powered assistantto handle customer questions, support tickets, and interactions seamlessly across marketing and support channels.

Problem: The "savings per month & latency" panel adds visual noise with little value to the user. Approach: Remove the panel from the default view, moving metrics to a developer panel. Value: Cleans up the UI, focusing the user on the core interaction.

For each proposed business solution, explore whether it could be applied to solve other problems, enter other markets, or serve new customer niches. Conversely, evaluate if the product is too broad and should focus on a specific audience. Quantify findings to aid in benchmarking and in evaluating external products.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: EHG Business Planning Framework Inspired by Exelon

extras.Description_1: Leverage the latest Exelon business plan structure to design EHGs planning system. This includes defining North Stars, top priorities, outcomes, critical milestones, and initiatives. Create a multi-level performance metric system (Level 1, 2, 3), corresponding scorecards, and thresholds.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: External Differentiator Stack for Venture Identity, Design, and Brand Cohesion

extras.Description_1: Problem: As EHG launches ventures all powered by AI agents, external-facing differentiation becomes critical. These companies may share a common backend and governance model but must appear distinct to humans through visual identity, storytelling, UX, and agent behavior.Solution: Establish a system-wide "Differentiator Stack" for each venture that guides creative direction, agent personality, messaging, visual design, and go-to-market strategy  based on five key external-facing factors:The 5 Differentiators:1. Strategic Narrative (e.g., Human Flourishing vs. Capital Dominance)2. Venture Thesis (e.g., Amplify Creativity vs. Monetize Edge Cases)3. Agent Personality & UX Style (e.g., Warm Guide vs. Sharp Expert)4. Governance & Transparency (e.g., Fully Audited vs. Silent Execution)5. Ecosystem Exposure (e.g., Platform APIs vs. Stealthy Consumer Tools)Implementation Plan: Create a Differentiator Tag Schema for tagging ventures (as enums or structured tags) Integrate with EVA Venture Evaluator and RefinedVentureInput Store tags in Shared Knowledge Base (SKB) for agent access Use tags to influence: Homepage copy and slogans (CopyGenAgent) Color palette and UI decisions (ClaudeCode UI Sub-Agent) Agent tone/personality (via LEO prompt-conditioning) Differentiation-aware GTM playbooks Dynamic directory views and filters in EVA UI (e.g., Show me all Warm Agents with Transparent Governance)Workflow Integration: Tags created automatically during venture onboarding/evaluation Used by CreativePersonaAgent to generate design tokens, branding assets, and messaging templates Custom GTM strategies assigned based on Differentiator StackOutcome:This system ensures every EHG venture feels distinctive and cohesive, enhancing brand clarity and emotional resonance while aligning all design and GTM outputs with the intended human-facing narrative. It transforms design and messaging from ad hoc work to automated strategy-driven execution.Optional Enhancements: Generate Differentiator-Based Branding Briefs Score distribution across portfolio to analyze balance (e.g., too many closed-loop ventures?) Add Differentiator-aware sorting and views to public-facing venture directory

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Leverage High-Quality Website Designs for Personal Branding and Venture Exposure

extras.Description_1: Objective: Utilize the output of beautifully crafted, high-performance websites as a strategic branding asset.Implementation Plan: Use polished design work as a portfolio showcase on RickFelix.com to enhance personal brand authority. Apply select designs or frameworks to CodeStreet Labs to establish visual consistency and professional presentation for the studio. Build a LinkedIn Marketing Persona by sharing behind-the-scenes design processes, principles, and agent-assisted workflows used to create those sites.Potential Benefits: Demonstrates taste and technical ability in a public forum Positions Rick Felix as a founder/designer/developer with AI-enhanced capabilities Builds inbound traffic, credibility, and attention for EHG ventures and sub-brandsExtensions: Integrate portfolio items with Figma files, video explainers, or Veo-generated branding content Cross-post case studies or design tear-downs to Medium or LinkedIn articles Use EVA agents to maintain and update portfolio and personal brand channels dynamically

Problem: EVA's behavior is not user-configurable. Approach: Add a centralized preferences panel for users to control voice, tone, privacy, memory, and connected accounts. Value: Empowers users to tailor the EVA experience to their needs.

Enable EVA to synchronize with Google Calendar, Gmail, and Google Tasks to manage schedules, communications, and to-do lists. This will improve contextual awareness and operational efficiency. Also consider using a separate Google account dedicated to EHG for better data separation and management.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Identify 5 Investment-Aligned Companies or Portfolios with Thematic Fit

extras.Description_1: I need to identify five companies or portfolios that focus their investments on specific types of ventures, ideally aligned to a central theme (e.g., Find my notes on the different types of companies or portfolios I shoudl setup). These could serve as strategic inspiration, potential acquirers, or funding sources for EHG ventures. The goal is to better align our roadmap with investor interests and increase exit potential.

A dedicated Go-to-Market module should exist outside of the core product applicationperhaps as part of the EHT layer. GTM is multifaceted and includes marketing, sales strategy, copywriting, material creation, and design. Each sub-discipline within GTM may require its own module and deserves independent deep research. Additionally, existing automated tools and services that provide GTM functionality should be studied for feature and functionality inspiration.

After finalizing all PRD files for a new application, they should be run through independent deep research reviews to identify the most accurate technical models and design approaches, maximizing the application's chance of success, adoption, and profitability.

Within branding, the narrative and emotional resonance are 80% of the value. Success depends on deeply understanding the customers psychology, context, and aspirations. The system should emphasize customer understanding in all branding-related modules and ensure story-driven branding strategies are central to venture development.

Problem: Without clear, measurable goals, prioritization for the next product cycle will be arbitrary. Approach: Define the high-level strategic goals for Q4 2025 and translate them into measurable Objectives and Key Results (OKRs). Value: Aligns the entire team on the most important priorities.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Automate MVP Feedback Loops with A/B Testing

extras.Description_1: The ultimate goal is to build and launch MVPs to gather real-world feedback. This feedback will help determine which ventures are worth continuing and which should be sunset. Ideally, this process becomes automatedcapturing structured user feedback, running A/B tests, analyzing behavioral data, and using that insight to inform decisions. This function should integrate with the core EHG platform and play a critical role in optimizing venture focus and resource allocation.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Adaptive Feedback Learning for Idea Evaluation

extras.Description_1: As I review ideas in the backlog, the system should make it easy for me to give feedback on what I like or dislike. Over time, it should learn from my preferences and begin predicting my responses. Eventually, it should filter and surface only the most relevant, high-quality suggestions that align with my decision patterns.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Leverage Multiple LLM Runs for Better Ideas

extras.Description_1: To improve output quality, consider running prompts through multiple variations or parallel LLM sessions. While this increases cost slightly, LLM prices are trending downward, making this more feasible. The goal is to achieve more intelligent, high-quality results by testing different versions and choosing the best one.

A process module should be created that encourages exploring multiple alternative solutions to any given problem. Each option should be critically evaluated with a risk-focused lensasking what could go wrong and iterating until the best solution emerges.

There needs to be a clearly articulated sales funnel process integrated into the planning phase of each venture. This includes defining each stage of the customer journey from awareness to conversion, and aligning this with marketing, product, and onboarding strategies. The process should be standardized and adaptable across ventures.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Integrate Stunning AI UI Design Principles into Multi-Agent Workflow

extras.Description_1:
### The Deep Research Prompt

**Persona:** You are an expert AI Systems and Frontend Development Strategist. Your expertise lies at the intersection of advanced AI/LLM capabilities, professional software engineering practices, and cutting-edge UI/UX design. You are tasked with creating a definitive report on the state-of-the-art for building web interfaces with AI.

**Objective:** To generate a comprehensive research report on the methodologies, technologies, and best practices for creating visually stunning, production-grade web applications using a collaborative, multi-agent AI system. The report should synthesize information from various domains, including frontend development, AI prompt engineering, and automated software testing.

**Context:** The foundational concept is a multi-agent AI workflow consisting of a "Manager Agent," a "Claude Code UI Agent," and a "Playwright Tester Agent." This system aims to go beyond simple code generation by incorporating advanced creative techniques, professional coding standards, and a robust, automated feedback loop. Your research should explore, validate, and expand upon every component of this workflow.

---

**Key Research Areas - Please provide a deep and thorough analysis on the following pillars:**

**1. Advanced Creative & Interactive Frontend Techniques:**
* **Analysis of Specific Libraries:**
    * **Animation:** Deep dive into `Framer Motion`. Compare its pros and cons against alternatives like `GSAP` (GreenSock Animation Platform) and native CSS animations for AI-generated code.
    * **Interactive Backgrounds & Shaders:** Investigate `Paper Shaders`. What are its performance implications? What are other WebGL or Canvas-based libraries that can be effectively controlled by an AI to produce stunning visuals?
* **Advanced CSS & SVG Techniques:**
    * **Creative Masking:** Explore the full potential of CSS `clip-path` and SVG masks. Provide a gallery of use cases and discuss the browser compatibility and performance trade-offs.
    * **Fluid & "Gooey" Effects:** Deconstruct the SVG filter technique (`feGaussianBlur`, `feColorMatrix`). Are there more modern or efficient CSS-only alternatives for achieving similar fluid visual effects?
* **Scroll-Triggered Animations:** Detail the mechanics behind `useScroll` and `useTransform` in Framer Motion. Research best practices for creating performant, non-disruptive scroll-based interactions.

**2. Agentic AI Development Workflows:**
* **Multi-Agent System Architecture:** Research the theory and practical application of multi-agent AI systems in software development. What are the optimal roles for different agents (e.g., Planner, Coder, Tester, Refactorer)?
* **Prompt Chaining & State Management:** How is the "state" of a project passed between agents? Analyze different techniques for maintaining consistency and context throughout a long and complex development process.
* **The "Manager Agent" Role:** Define the ideal responsibilities of a managerial AI. How should it interpret user requests, delegate tasks, synthesize feedback, and make decisions?

**3. AI Context & Memory Management at Scale:**
* **Context Anchoring Techniques:** Deep dive into the methodology of providing a "Global Context" in every prompt.
    * **Codebase Mapping:** Research the concept of maintaining a `map.md` file. How should it be structured for maximum effectiveness? How can it be automatically updated as the codebase grows?
    * **"Golden Files":** Analyze the psychological and technical impact of providing high-quality code examples. How does this influence the AI's output in terms of style, structure, and quality?
* **Iterative & Diff-Based Prompting:** Research the best practices for asking an AI to plan its work before execution and to provide changes in a `diff` format. What are the benefits for code review, version control, and reducing token usage?

**4. Automated QA & Visual Feedback Loops:**
* **Browser Automation Tools:** Provide a detailed comparison of `Playwright`, `Cypress`, and `Puppeteer` specifically for use in an AI feedback loop. Which offers the best combination of speed, features, and ease of providing descriptive feedback?
* **Visual Regression Testing:** Go beyond basic functional checks. Research how to integrate automated visual regression testing tools (e.g., `Percy`, `Applitools`, `Lost Pixel`) into this workflow. How can an AI interpret the results of a visual diff?
* **Parsing Feedback:** What is the most effective format for the Tester Agent's report? How should it describe errors, layout issues, or animation failures so that the Coder Agent can understand and act upon the feedback with maximum accuracy?

---

**Requested Output Format:**

Please structure your response as a formal research report with the following sections:

* **1. Executive Summary:** A high-level overview of the key findings and the final, recommended workflow.
* **2. In-Depth Analysis of Research Pillars:** A detailed section for each of the four key research areas listed above.
* **3. The Synthesized 'Stunning UI' Workflow:** A definitive, step-by-step model of the best-practice workflow, combining all the researched concepts into a single, actionable guide.
* **4. Future Outlook & Emerging Technologies:** A forward-looking analysis of what's next in this space. Mention potential impacts of real-time context windows, self-healing code, and AI-native development environments.
Create a UI to configure agents from templates, setting roles, tools, permissions, memory, and lifecycle rules (versioning, promotion, rollback).
Create pre-configured templates for executive AI agents (CEO, COO, VP) with defined scope, delegation matrices, OKRs, and escalation paths to ensure consistency.

These assets would enhance reach, engagement, and perceived value of your SaaS ventures.

They align qualitative sentiment with behavioral analytics and strategic KPIs such as retention and revenue, enabling predictive modeling to detect churn risk before feedback is even given. This enables a dynamic, data-driven roadmap and customer-centric product evolution with minimal manual intervention.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Integrate Stunning AI UI Design Principles into Multi-Agent Workflow

extras.Description_1: Leverage the creative insights from the original "Stunning AI UI" YouTube video by incorporating its five key design principlesinteractive backgrounds (Paper Shaders), purposeful animations (Framer Motion), strategic layouts (Landbook), SVG-based graphics, and diverse fontsinto the Claude Code UI Agent's design prompts. These form the creative "what to build" layer of the system. The full prompt flow includes a long-term memory agent workflow with context-aware initialization, codebase mapping, modular UI generation, project memory management via map.md, and automated visual testing via a Playwright Agent. This aligns artistic inspiration with engineering scalability in a professional-grade AI design and development process.

Emotional impact refers to avoiding generic, low-effort copy in favor of compelling, standout messaging. The system should differentiate between low-value "blanket emails" and high-value, emotionally resonant outreach that captures attention.

Design is a critical part of product development.  Curate, don't create  AI can generate infinite screens, logos, and layouts. Your value isn't in pressing "generate"it's in deciding what's good, what's trash, and what's worth refining. Taste and judgment separate you from everyone else using the same tools.  Stay human  Design isn't just what's on the screen. It's empathy, context, and the ability to know when to break rules. AI is powerful, but it can't feel what users feel. The best designers combine human intuition with AI efficiency.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Tiered Competitive Intelligence Framework for SaaS

extras.Description_1: To secure a competitive advantage, SaaS companies should adopt a tiered framework that transforms raw public datalike website traffic, job postings, and customer reviewsinto calculated KPIs and then strategic insights. Key analysis includes using headcount to infer revenue, review analysis on G2/Capterra, and tracking product momentum through hiring velocity and release cadence. For B2C, viral metrics like DAU/MAU and viral coefficient are critical. The ultimate goal is to reveal competitor weaknesses, such as inefficient LTV:CAC ratios or misaligned messaging, and use this intelligence to craft strategies that win market share and build moats.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Balancing PRD Adherence with Lovable Creativity

A balanced approach is neededone that offers Lovable just enough structure to align with the vision, while still allowing room for creative problem-solving.

When using Lovable, a critical prompt strategy is to instruct the system to first spend time thinking about a rubric based on the PRD. It should think deeply about what defines a world-class one-shot web application, and use that internal framework to guide the creation. After building the initial version, it should use the rubric again to internally reflect and iterate on the best possible solution.

sd_backlog_map.backlog_title: Build Samsung Galaxy Watch App Using Wear OS and Cursor

extras.Description_1: Explore the development of a custom application for the Galaxy Watch 8, leveraging its Wear OS support. Use Cursor for writing code and Android Studio for SDK/tools setup. You can create: 1) Full Wear OS apps (Kotlin/Jetpack Compose), 2) Watch faces (using Watch Face Studio with Wear OS 5+ compliance). Setup Steps: Install Android Studio to manage SDK & build tools. Use "Empty Wear App" template to seed Gradle project. Open the project in Cursor and write Kotlin code targeting Wear OS. Enable Developer Mode on the watch (Settings  About  Software Info  tap Build Number 7x). Connect via ADB-over-Wi-Fi (adb connect WATCH_IP:5555) and sideload APK with adb install.Permissions & APIs: Include BODY_SENSORS and ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION if using fitness data. Use Health Services APIs to optimize battery efficiency.Alternate Option: Use Watch Face Studio for no-code/low-code custom watch face creation, required for Wear OS 5+ Play Store submissions.Next Step:If desired, request a Kotlin/Jetpack Compose starter project scaffolded with Gradle tasks and ADB deployment scripts tailored to your Galaxy Watch IP.
Include a backlog criterion asking "How will we add polish, story, or emotion to this MVP?" Virality often hinges on this.

Problem: By the time metrics are reviewed, opportunities may have passed. Approach: Develop a real-time analytics layer on the data lake to monitor key metrics and automatically detect significant anomalies. Value: Enables proactive responses to important deviations from the norm.

Problem: Cloud costs can easily spiral out of control without active management. Approach: Develop an agent that monitors cloud spending, identifies saving opportunities, and can automatically take action to optimize costs. Value: Enforces financial discipline on infrastructure spend.

Once the core problem is identified, a system should support proposing multiple diverse solutions, followed by structured analysis of each one. Each solution should be stress-tested to identify failure points, enabling selection of the most robust and viable approach.
